'Whoa, that's quite a crowd!'%K%P
I turned up at the usual park\njust as Shuri was about to start practice.%K%P
'What are you going to do? Go ahead and start?'%K%P
'Of course. Everyone here is a Love☆Kami fan, right?\nSo some of them must like Kagura more than me.'%K%P
'Which means this is a chance to win some new fans!'%K%P
She clearly intended to steal some of Kagura's fans.\nNow that they were going head to head,\nShuri was showing no mercy.%K%P
'It's not like the number of fans matters\nin the final vote, why go that far?'%K%P
'What are you talking about?\nFor Divine Idols, fans equal power!'%K%P
'Oh, right, Sakimitama and all that...'%K%P
Goddesses' power depends on the quality\nand amount of Sakimitama they get.%K%P
The more fans a Divine Idol has,\nthe better a performance she can give.%K%P
The reason L☆SEVEN stays so dominant\nis largely due to the power they've gained\nfrom their fans.%K%P
And with that power they can give better\nperformances than anyone else,\nmaking them basically untouchable.%K%P
'I know Kagura's doing the same thing at\nAmano Kaguyama, so she's not losing out too much.%K%P
'But having said that, it's not exactly fair\nfor me to get help from you, either.\nSorry, but you just stand over there and watch, OK?'%K%P
'OK then, here I go!'%K%P
Shuri went out and started dancing for her fans.%K%P
Even this park in the backstreets of Akihabara\nwas a stage to her.%K%P
She used to be so shy, but now\nshe can stand proudly in front of anyone.%K%P
It's hard to notice, being so close all the time,\nbut she's really growing up.%K%P
'Phew, I worked up a good sweat there.'%K%P
Practice finished, Shuri could finally\ncatch a breather.%K%P
I handed her a sports drink, which she drank gladly.%K%P
'OK then...'%K%P
Still holding the bottle,\nshe deftly tapped at her phone.%K%P
'What's wrong?'%K%P
'Um... It's nothing...'%K%P
The last few days, Shuri had been\nchecking her phone a lot.%K%P
Whenever she did she always ended up looking sad,\nso Kagura and I were getting worried.%K%P
'Have you found a boyfriend?'%K%P
'Of course not! How rude!'%K%P
'Is that rude?'%K%P
'Of course it's rude!\nDo you think I'd do something dumb like fall in love\nwith the audition coming up?'%K%P
'Well, when you put it that way...'%K%P
'But, just so you know, being a Divine Idol\ndoesn't mean we can't date and stuff.'%K%P
'I'm just saying\nnow isn't the time for stuff like that, is all.'%K%P
Shuri is pretty picky about this kind of thing.%K%P
She can be kind of uptight like a class captain,\nand sometimes acts super serious.%K%P
She's the complete opposite of carefree Kagura,\nbut that's why they worked as a duo,\neach had what the other didn't.%K%P
'I'm only telling because I hate misunderstandings,\nbut I'm texting with my sister.'%K%P
Shuri's sister is Bishamonten,\na member of L☆SEVEN.%K%P
'I think I already told you,\nbut I entered this audition without telling her.'%K%P
'I finally told her about it,\nbut she hasn't replied.'%K%P
'She's probably just too busy to answer.'%K%P
'I don't think so.\nShe's got time when she's going between places,\nit's not that hard to send a reply.'%K%P
'...Well, that is kind of worrying then.'%K%P
'I wonder what's going on with her...'%K%P
'I'll try asking Sara if she knows anything.'%K%P
I can't get directly involved in the audition,\nbut I'd like to help out where I can.%K%P
As the unofficial third member of Love☆Kami,\nI want to stay involved somehow.%K%P
But that evening, before I could ask Sara,\nI got a message from Shuri.%K%P
[My sister answered.]%K%P
[I'm sorry I worried you.\nEverything's okay now.]%K%P
'Well, I'm glad it worked out at least.'%K%P
I bet Shuri was relieved to hear from her sister.%K%P
Now she can focus on practicing to get ready\nfor the audition.%K%P
